extendedIngredients.name: cream cheese
extendedIngredients.originalString: 3 packages (8 ounces each) cream cheese, softened

extendedIngredients.aisle: Nut butters, Jams, and Honey;Health Foods
extendedIngredients.name: honey
semisweet chocolate chips
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup (6 ounces) semisweet chocolate chips, melted

recipes.title: Chocolate-Topped Chocolate Cheesecake

winePairing.pairingText: Cake can be paired with Cream Sherry, Moscato d'Asti, and Port. A common wine pairing rule is to make sure your wine is sweeter than your food. Delicate desserts go well with Moscato d'Asti, nutty desserts with cream sherry, and caramel or chocolate desserts pair well with port. One wine you could try is NV Solera Cream Sherry. It has 4.5 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 17 dollars.

productMatches.title: NV Solera Cream Sherry
productMatches.description: The Solera Cream Sherry has a brilliant amber and deep copper hue. With butterscotch and pecan aromas, the sweet salted nut and brown spice aromas carry a complex caramel accent. A sweet entry leads to a rounded, lush, moderately full-bodied palate with a lengthy, flavorful finish.

recipes.instructions: Directions                                                                                                                                            In a large bowl, combine the cracker crumbs, sugar and cocoa; stir in butter until crumbly. Press onto the bottom and 1-in. up the side of a greased 9-in. springform pan; set aside.                                                                                                                                                        In a small bowl, beat cream cheese and sugar until smooth. Add eggs; beat on low speed just until combined. Stir in melted chocolate and extracts just until blended. Pour into crust.                                                                                                                                                       Bake at 350 for 45-50 minutes or until center is almost set. Cool on a wire rack for 10 minutes. Carefully run knife around the edge of pan to loosen; cool 1 hour longer. Refrigerate until completely cooled.                                                                                                                                                       In a small saucepan over low heat, melt the chocolate chips, cream and honey; stir until smooth. Remove from the heat; cool for 5 minutes. Pour topping over the cheesecake. Chill for at least 4 hours or until topping is set.                                                        Yield: 12 servings.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 Originally published as Chocolate Cheesecake in  Taste of HomeOctober/November 2002, p48                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Print                                                                                                                                                Add to Recipe Box                                                                                                                                                            Email a Friend

steps.step: In a large bowl, combine the cracker crumbs, sugar and cocoa; stir in butter until crumbly. Press onto the bottom and 1-in. up the side of a greased 9-in. springform pan; set aside.
In a small bowl, beat cream cheese and sugar until smooth.
Add eggs; beat on low speed just until combined. Stir in melted chocolate and extracts just until blended.

Bake at 350 for 45-50 minutes or until center is almost set. Cool on a wire rack for 10 minutes. Carefully run knife around the edge of pan to loosen; cool 1 hour longer. Refrigerate until completely cooled.
In a small saucepan over low heat, melt the chocolate chips, cream and honey; stir until smooth.
Remove from the heat; cool for 5 minutes.
Pour topping over the cheesecake. Chill for at least 4 hours or until topping is set.
